resources.string: After pressing this button, Android will start searching for other Bluetooth devices that have made themselves discoverable. When Bluetooth is not yet enabled, you will be asked to enable it.
After pressing this button, Android will stop searching for new devices but will Bluetooth will stay on. The system will wait for further user input.

All found Bluetooth devices will be displayed here. There is nothing yet because you have not started searching and discovered any devices. New devices will be displayed per row, in the format: device name - device MAC address.

In the overflow, the settings can be accessed. In the settings the preferred device name, MAC address and UUID for the device you want to connect to, can be made. Device name and MAC address are optional but the UUID is required to make a connection.
After pressing this button, a file explorer with files from your storage will pop up. Once a file has been selected, it will be send in the background to the connected device.

After pressing this button, a file explorer with files from the arduino to be send to you, will pop up. From the list of files, one can be selected to be send to your device and saved into your downloads folder.

After pressing this button, the connection between your Android and the arduino will be cancelled. This is very useful for saving battery power since having an unused connection is unnecessary power consumption.
Here status of your current action will be displayed. Now the status is "-" since no action has been done yet. After sending or retrieving files, the status will be updated.
"The application works only with Bluetooth enabled. "
Your device does not support Bluetooth.
" Do you want to connect to: "
A device matched your preferred name.
A device matched your preferred MAC address.
Bluetooth was disabled. Do you want to enable it?
